thread.title: Springfield supports dancer Mike Makowski at THON 2017 with signs of friend
thread.title_full: Springfield supports dancer Mike Makowski at THON 2017 with signs of friend

author: Frank Esposito | The Daily Collegian
title: Springfield supports dancer Mike Makowski at THON 2017 with signs of friend
text:
Buy Now Connor Kane

Mike Makowski (senior-biochemistry and molecular biology) is surprised by his special interest organization, Springfiled, during Penn State THON 2017 at the Bryce Jordan Center on Sunday, Feb. 19, 2017. Springfield supports dancer Mike Makowski at THON 2017 with signs of friend Buy Now Connor Kane 
Mike Makowski (senior-biochemistry and molecular biology) is surprised by his special interest organization, Springfiled, during Penn State THON 2017 at the Bryce Jordan Center on Sunday, Feb. 19, 2017. 
This year's Springfield dancer Mike Makowski (senior-biochemistry and molecular biology) got extra help in the waning hours of THON early Sunday morning. 
Springfield members in attendance at this year's THON held up a a series of signs with pictures of his friend Kelcey Hallinan, along with the hashtag #KelceyStrong. Related THON dancer Mike Makowski shares losing his close friend and why he THONs 
THON 2017 dancer Mike Makowski explains why he partakes in the cause. 
Beth Reilly helped organize the display in order to boost his morale in the waning hours of THON, she said. 
"It's just the boost he needs at this hour," Reilly (sophomore-supply chain information systems) said. 
Hallinan died from Hodgkinâ€™s lymphoma about three years ago. Makowski uses Hallinan's story to motivate other Springfield members, Reilly said. +1 
Mike Makowski (senior-biochemistry and molecular biology) is surprised by his special interest organization, Springfiled, during Penn State THON 2017 at the Bryce Jordan Center on Sunday, Feb. 19, 2017. Connor Kane 
"He misses her a lot and we wanted to show him how he's helping battle cancer," Reilly said. 
The pictures of Hallinan showed her in a shirt with space cats on it, a testament to her silly personality, Reilly said.
